resources.string: Hey there! This game is about solving quadratic equations at speed! Don\'t need to be a math genius — just knowing some basic arithmetic. There are 2 simple steps to solve the equation
To make things easier, our equation is represented as 3 numbers. Our goal is to find 2 solutions (roots). We\'ll try to solve this equation:\n[2, -10, 12]

Firstly, the first number must be 1. To do that, just divide all three numbers by the first one. In our case, the first number is 2 — but we need 1. So we divide each number by 2, and now, the equation looks like:\n[1, -5, 6]

Now, you need to find 2 unknown numbers that satisfy the condition:

• Their sum equals the second number, BUT WITH THE OPPOSITE SIGN
• Their product just equals the last number

Since our equation is [1, -5, 6], we need:

• Sum = 5
• Product = 6

After trying some numbers, we find 2 and 3 because:

• 2 + 3 = 5
• 2 × 3 = 6

So, these numbers are the roots of our equation!

• Easy — Equations with positive roots, and first number is 1
• Medium — Same as Easy, but includes negative roots too
• Hard — Like Medium, but the first number cannot be equal only 1
• Growth — Starts easy and levels up to hard
